text.title: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC

head.s: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC

p.s: This wikiHow teaches you how to add a Windows 10 computer to a domain .
You can add a computer to a domain using the Control Panel or Windows Settings .
After you join your computer to a local domain , you can log in to the domain at the Windows Sign In screen .

item.s: Click the Windows Start button .
It 's the button that has the Windows logo .
By default , it can be found in the task bar in the lower-left corner .
This displays the Windows Start menu .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 1.jpg

item.s: Type and press .
This displays the Control Panel in the Windows Start menu .
It 's the app that has an icon that resembles a computer screen with graphs .

Click the Control Panel , or press the
Enter
key to open the Control Panel .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 2.jpg

item.s: Click .
It 's the green text next to the icon that resembles a blue shield next to a planet .
This opens the System and Security Settings menu .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 3.jpg

item.s: Click .
It 's the green text next to an icon that resembles a computer screen .
This displays system information .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 4.jpg

item.s: Click .
This is across from the computer name , domain and work group information .
This displays the System Properties menu .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 5.jpg

item.s: Click the tab .
It 's the first tab at the top of the System Properties menu .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 6.jpg

item.s: Click .
It 's the last button in the System Properties menu .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 7.jpg

item.s: Click .
It 's the first radial button at the bottom of the " Computer Name/Domain Changes " .

You can select a
Domain
or
Workgroup
.

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 8.jpg

item.s: Type the domain name and click .
Type the name or URL of the domain you would like to join .
If you are not sure what the domain name is , consult the network administrator .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 9.jpg

item.s: Type an administrator 's username and password and click .
You need to have permission from a network administrator to join a domain .

Type a network administrator 's username and password and click
Ok
to join .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 10.jpg

item.s: Click .
You may see a welcome prompt , and a prompt advising you to restart your computer .

Click
Ok
to acknowledge .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 11.jpg

item.s: Click .
This closes the System Properties window .
A prompt immediately displays asking you to restart your computer .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 12.jpg

item.s: Click .
Before you log in to the domain with your computer , it must be restarted .

If prompted , click
Restart Now
.
If you are not prompted to restart your computer , use the following steps to restart .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 13.jpg

item.s:
Click the
Windows Start
button .
Click the icon with the circle with a line through the top .

Click
Restart
Click .

After your computer restarts , you can log in to your computer locally using your Windows username and password , or click
Other User
in the lower-left corner to log in to the domain .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 14.jpg

item.s: Type the domain name/administrator 's username .
In the first bar where you would normally type your Windows username , type the domain followed by a slash ( / ) , then followed by an administrator 's username .
For example , " Company/adminstrator " .

figure.rend: Add a Computer to a Domain on PC Step 15.jpg

item.s: Type the administrative password and press .
Type an administrative password in the box below the bar with the domain and user name .

Press the
Enter
key , or click the arrow to the side of the password bar to log in to the domain .
